intro: Kleinia dolichocoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kleinia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, known as farina. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Kleinia dolichocoma is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
